contentrichtext.text: {{Selfref|For guidelines on using of this unit on Wikipedia, see [[WP:PEBIBYTE]].}} {{Redirect|PiB|other things abbreviating to PiB or PIB|PIB (disambiguation)}} {{Quantities of bytes}} The '''pebibyte''' is a standards-based [[binary prefix|binary multiple]] (prefix [[pebi-|''pebi'']], symbol ''Pi'') of the [[byte]], a unit of [[Computer data storage|digital information storage]]. The pebibyte unit symbol is '''PiB'''.<ref name="NIST">{{cite web|url=http://physics.nist.gov/cuu/Units/binary.html|title=Prefixes for binary multiples|date=2007|publisher=NIST|accessdate=10 August 2007}}</ref> : 1 pebibyte = 2<sup>50</sup> [[byte]]s = {{gaps|1|125|899|906|842|624|bytes}} = 1024 [[tebibyte]]s The pebibyte is closely related to the [[petabyte]], which is defined as 10<sup>15</sup> bytes = {{gaps|1|000|000|000|000|000|bytes}} (see [[binary prefix]]). 1 PiB â‰ˆ 1.13 PB. ==See also== * [[Orders of magnitude (data)]] * [[Pebibit]] * [[Exbibyte]] * [[SI prefix]] * [[IEEE 1541]] ==References== {{Reflist}} [[Category:Units of information]]
